page.title: 06TOURISM IN WARMINSTER
page.content: Warminster's historic and beautiful setting attracts many tourists. But with a new by-pass soon to be built around Warminster, tourists might just drive straight past the town, affecting local employment. So a special Committee for the Promotion of Warminster has been set up. The 20 Committee members are Councillors, traders and other volunteers who meet monthly to think up ideas. The Town Council gives money and other help. Already they have moved the Tourist Information Office to the new Library, rewritten the Town Guide, designed new Tourist Leaflets and set up a Nature Walk. Along the by-pass, signs will tell tourists about Warminster. Committee Chairman, former Mayor Mr Tony Duke, believes that in the end the by-pass will make Warminster a more attractive place for tourists.
